channel.title: Runserver.bat help (PLEASE help me I'm a noob)
channel.description:
When I try to open my runserver.bat the window comes up and quickly closes. I was able to get a screenshot of what it said before it closed quick enough. I'm using the allstarscape V2 with Windows 7. The compile works though. I beg for help.
[img]http://i272.photobucket.com/albums/jj168/Roboticopperatingbuddy/moparhelprunserverbat.png[/img]
It looks like it says [b]'java' is not recognized as and internal or external command, operable program or batch file.[/b]
The code that's inside it is: [code]@echo off color 0a title Allstar-Scape java -Xmx512m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.08-ga-bin.jar server[/code]
Someone please help me fix this I have no idea what to do I've tried like 5 different sources I'm a total noob at this.

item.title: Runserver.bat help (PLEASE help me I'm a noob)
item.dc:creator: @4markie 4markie
item.description:
@4markie wrote:

FIXED

Those of you who wanna know how I fixed it.

Is because in 7 and Vista they have “Program Files (x86)”

The path had just “program files” as it was meant for XP

You might want the add this in the main guide.

Thanks for the help anyway.

Read full topic
item.source: Runserver.bat help (PLEASE help me I'm a noob)

item.title: Runserver.bat help (PLEASE help me I'm a noob)
item.dc:creator: @o0o o0o
item.description:
@o0o wrote:

So you have actually downloaded JDK 1.6.0_18? Go to C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_18 and see if the folder exists.

Read full topic
item.source: Runserver.bat help (PLEASE help me I'm a noob)

item.title: Runserver.bat help (PLEASE help me I'm a noob)
item.dc:creator: @4markie 4markie
item.description:
@4markie wrote:

I already set it is there anything wrong with these codes that I have in there?

These are in the top box (User variables)

Classpath:

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_18\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

Path:

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_18\bin

Version of JDK: jdk1.6.0_18

Read full topic

item.title: Runserver.bat help (PLEASE help me I'm a noob)
item.dc:creator: @WowILikeToCode WowILikeToCode
item.description:
@WowILikeToCode wrote:

You need to set your path and Classpath
Start>Right click my computer>Properties>advanced>enviromental variables

Read full topic
